dt: {bc}a geographic area and especially a neighborhood that is inhabited and frequented by {d_link|LGBTQ+|LGBTQ+} people and that has many businesses which cater to the LGBTQ+ community

dt.t: Back when people were declaring the death of American cities, LGBTQ+ residents in search of affordable housing gravitated to urban areas, and eventually created {wi}gayborhoods{/wi}—cultural enclaves of community and belonging.

dt: often capitalized when used to refer to a specific area or neighborhood

dt.t: The Cauldron's Philadelphia location, in the {wi}Gayborhood{/wi}, will host drag shows, as well.

While many LGBTQ bars in "The {wi}Gayborhood{/wi}," as the LGBTQ community affectionately calls Mount Vernon [in Baltimore, Maryland], have shuttered, this Mount Vernon dive bar will mark its 50th anniversary next year.

aq.auth: Stephanie García and John-John Williams IV

shortdef: a geographic area and especially a neighborhood that is inhabited and frequented by LGBTQ+ people and that has many businesses which cater to the LGBTQ+ community —often capitalized when used to refer to a specific area or neighborhood
